subject: Re: [junit] Looking for some "Best Practices"
msgSnippet: ... Last time I looked IntelliJ only allowed one class template (which isn t enough!). ... I like the /test/ expansion idea, but... I can t be bothered typing
messageBody:
Erik Hanson wrote:

> This will be no exception, then :) IntelliJ IDEA has two kinds of
> templates, both of which could be useful for generating test cases. One
> type is a template for new files,

Last time I looked IntelliJ only allowed one class template (which
isn't enough!).


> and the other type is a template that
> can be inserted at any time (for example, I type "test" and hit "tab",
> and "public void test|() { }" is inserted for me (where "|" is the new
> location of the text cursor)).

I like the /test/ expansion idea, but... I can't be bothered typing
this[1] in day in day out:

Bill de hÓra


[1] package @package

import junit.framework.TestCase;
import junit.framework.TestSuite;
import junit.textui.TestRunner;
import java.util.*;
import java.io.*;
import com.propylon.test.UnitTestable;


/**
*
* @version $Revision: 1.1 $
* @author <a href="mailto:bill.dehora@...">Bill de hÓra</a>
*/
public class @Class
extends TestCase implements UnitTestable
{

public @Class( String name )
{
super(name);
}

public static void main(String[] args)
{
TestRunner.run(suite());
}

public static Test suite()
{
return new TestSuite(@...);
}

protected void setUp()
{ }

protected void tearDown()
{ }

}
